problem_text:
Is a (conjugacy, p-conjugacy) biprimitively finite group finite if it has a finite maximal subgroup (p-subgroup)? There are affirmative answers for conjugacy biprimitively finite p-groups and for 2-conjugacy biprimitively finite groups (V. P. Shunkov, Algebra and Logic, 9, no. 4 (1970), 291–297; 11, no. 4 (1972), 260–272; 12, no. 5 (1973), 347–353), while the statement does not hold for arbitrary periodic groups, see Archive, 3.9.
V. P. Shunkov
